fact_text: In 1951, deep in the Idaho desert, the Experimental Breeder Reactor I quietly lit up four modest light bulbs, becoming the first nuclear power plant to generate electricity. That tiny pool of warm, artificial starlight marked a shift from theory to a new era of harnessing atomic forces for power, forever changing how humans imagined their energy future.

episode.title: Morning Drops #14 - Slow Planet
episode.description: A pause. A quiet return to slower rhythms, sparked by a live set under the summer sky. A moment to breathe and settle into the week.

match_reason: EBR-I’s four glowing bulbs were a small, almost meditative moment of technological dawn—quietly revolutionary rather than triumphant spectacle. “Slow Planet,” with its soft electronic textures and spacious downtempo mood, mirrors that sense of calm, tentative wonder at a new kind of energy humming into life on a remote, slow-turning planet.
